activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Rayshaun Bellamy Jr.

records.addlTxt: 11:07 AM Defendant Benjamin Rayshaun Bellamy Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Benjamin Rayshaun Bellamy Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Not guilty plea  Bond Continued.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:06 PM Defendant Benjamin Rayshaun Bellamy Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Benjamin Rayshaun Bellamy Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions. Preliminary hearing requested by Zoom and within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
